ontologyFramework.OFContextManagement

Class OWLReferences

  • java.lang.Object
    • ontologyFramework.OFContextManagement.OWLReferences

  • public class OWLReferences
extends java.lang.Object
    This class define a complete reference to a OWL ontology. In particular, it should be create to introduce an ontology into the framework. This class is compatible in all the part of the framework and it helps in moving ontologies through the computational flow.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Buoncomapgni Luca

    • Field Detail

      • CREATEcommand

        public static final int CREATEcommand
        Value to describe the create ontology command during class construction. It will create a new ontology as a file considering a given filePath.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOADFROMFILEcommand

        public static final int LOADFROMFILEcommand
        Value to describe the load from file command during class construction It will load an ontology w.r.t. filePath and ontoPath.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • LOADFROMWEBcommand

        public static final int LOADFROMWEBcommand
        Value to describe the load ontology from web command during class construction. In this case filePath will be set to null.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • OWLReferences

        public OWLReferences(OWLReferencesSerializable serial)
        Constructor to resume this class from its serialization variable. It can be retrieved using getSerialisableData( String). This is done since the reasoner and the ontology are not serializable trougth the interface Serializable
        Parameters:
        serial -

      • OWLReferences

        public OWLReferences(java.lang.String ontologyName,
             java.lang.String filePath,
             java.lang.String ontologyPath,
             int command)
        Create a new references to an ontology using the standard reasoner. By default it is set to Pellet reasoner with a buffering synchronisation.
        Parameters:
        ontologyName - name of this OWLReferences instances, used to refer to this instance.
        filePath - IRI path to the file where the ontology is stored.
        ontologyPath - IRI path of the ontology.
        command - value to define the create or load from file or web comand.

      • OWLReferences

        public OWLReferences(java.lang.String ontologyName,
             java.lang.String filePath,
             java.lang.String ontologyPath,
             org.semanticweb.owlapi.reasoner.OWLReasoner reasonerInstance,
             int command)
        Create a new references to an ontology.
        Parameters:
        ontologyName - name of this OWLReferences instances, used to refer to this instance.
        filePath - IRI path to the file where the ontology is stored.
        ontologyPath - IRI path of the ontology.
        reasonerInstance - instance to the reasoner to attach to this ontology.
        command - value to define the create or load from file or web comand.

    • Method Detail

      • setPelletReasoner

        public void setPelletReasoner(java.lang.Boolean buffering)
        Set the reasoner attached to this ontology as Pellet. If @param buffering is true than the ontology buffers changes that will be synchronized by the reasoner in one call to reasoner.flush();. If it is false than the reasoner will be synchronized at every changes of the ontology structure.
        Parameters:
        buffering - flag to set a buffering, or not buffering Pellet.

      • setHermitReasoner

        public void setHermitReasoner(java.lang.Boolean buffering)
        Set the reasoner attached to this ontology as Hermit. If @param buffering is true than the ontology buffers changes that will be synchronized by the reasoner in one call to reasoner.flush();. If it is false than the reasoner will be synchronized at every changes of the ontology structure.
        Parameters:
        buffering - reasoner buffering flag

      • setSnorocketReasoner

        public void setSnorocketReasoner(java.lang.Boolean buffering)
        Set the reasoner attached to this ontology as Snorocket. If @param buffering is true than the ontology buffers changes that will be synchronized by the reasoner in one call to reasoner.flush();. If it is false than the reasoner will be synchronized at every changes of the ontology structure.
        Parameters:
        buffering - reasoner buffering flag

      • setFactReasoner

        public void setFactReasoner(java.lang.Boolean buffering)
        Set the reasoner attached to this ontology as Fact++. If @param buffering is true than the ontology buffers changes that will be synchronized by the reasoner in one call to reasoner.flush();. If it is false than the reasoner will be synchronized at every changes of the ontology structure.
        Parameters:
        buffering - reasoner buffering flag

      • isBufferingReasoner

        public boolean isBufferingReasoner()
        Returns true if the reasoner has a buffering synchronisation. false if the reasoner is apdated at every ontological changes.
        Returns:
        the bufferingReasoner flag

      • getOntoName

        public java.lang.String getOntoName()
        Every OWLReferences has only one ontology attached to it. Moreover, every of them has a name used to statically refer to the different OWLReferences inside the framework. This name must be different for every OWLReferences since they are stored in an HashMap<String, OWLReferences>.
        Returns:
        the name of the OWLReferences.

        public org.semanticweb.owlapi.model.IRI getIriFilePath()

        the iriFilePath

        public java.lang.String getFilePath()
        Returns the IRI path to the file where the ontology is, as a String.
        Returns:
        the iriFilePath as a String

      • setFilePath

        public void setFilePath(java.lang.String filePath)
        Set the file Path of the ontology refereed by this instance. As long as is not the case in which an ontology should be locally saved from web is recommended to set this variable in during class constructors.
        Parameters:
        filePath - the filePath to set.

        public void setReasoner(org.semanticweb.owlapi.reasoner.OWLReasoner reasoner)
        Set an external reasoner instance to this ontology. The old relation to a reasoner will be deleted.
        Parameters:
        reasoner - the reasoner to set

      • getSerialisableData

        public OWLReferencesSerializable getSerialisableData()
        Serialize this class saving important quantities and using a special constructor: OWLReferences(OWLReferencesSerializable). Basically, it calls getSerialisableData(String) with input parameter filePath = this.getIriFilePath().
        Returns:
        serializable Data relate to this OWLReferences

      • getSerialisableData

        public OWLReferencesSerializable getSerialisableData(java.lang.String filePath)
        Serialize this class saving important quantities and using a special constructor: OWLReferences(OWLReferencesSerializable).
        Parameters:
        filePath - new file Path for the serializated class
        Returns:
        serializable Data relate to this OWLReferences

      • getAllInstances

        public static java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,OWLReferences> getAllInstances()
        Returns a map that contains all the instances of OWLReferences class create into the framework. Instances are organized w.r.t the ontoName attached to them
        Returns:
        Map between ontoName and OWKReferences

      • getOWLReferences

        public static OWLReferences getOWLReferences(java.lang.String referenceName)
        Return a particular OWLReferences, given its ontoName. Basically it just calls: return( this.getAllInstances().get(referenceName)).
        Parameters:
        referenceName - the name attached to a particolar OWLReferences (ontoName).
        Returns:
        the instance of this class attached to a particular name

      • isInAllInstances

        public static boolean isInAllInstances(java.lang.String key)
        check if exist an OWLReferences with a particolar name already stored in the Map (getAllInstances()). Basically it just calls: return( this.getAllInstance.containsKey( key))
        Parameters:
        key - ontoName used to store a OWLReferences.
        Returns:
        true if it exist, false otherwise.

      • checkConsistent

        public void checkConsistent()
        call the reasoner to check ontology consistency and synchronizes the consistency flag

      • getAllSerializableInstances

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,OWLReferencesSerializable> getAllSerializableInstances(java.lang.String basePath,
                                                                                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> nameToSerialize,
                                                                                    boolean exportInfer)
        It goes trough all the named instances of this class and for each of them calls getSerialisableData(String). Note that to properly serialize an OWLOntology that has to be saved in owl format.
        Parameters:
        basePath - folder path in which save the ontologies
        nameToSerialize - name of the ontologies to save. If this is null then all keys of getAllInstances() will be considered.
        exportInfer - if true all the asserted axiom will be exported in the Ontology
        Returns:
        the map of serializable data.
